title: Climate Change Impact on Sri Lankan Fisheries
content: Climate change poses significant challenges to Sri Lankan fisheries. Rising sea temperatures affect fish migration patterns, while changing weather patterns impact fishing seasons. This comprehensive analysis explores the current situation and potential adaptation strategies for sustainable fishing practices.
excerpt: Understanding how climate change affects Sri Lankan fisheries and adaptation strategies.
author: Dr. Marine Researcher

title: Policy Recommendations for Sustainable Fishing
content: Sustainable fishing practices require comprehensive policy frameworks. This article outlines key policy recommendations including quotas, seasonal restrictions, and community-based management approaches that can help preserve marine ecosystems while supporting fishing communities.
excerpt: Key policy recommendations to ensure sustainable fishing practices in Sri Lanka.
author: Policy Expert

title: Combating Overfishing in Coastal Waters
content: Overfishing threatens marine ecosystems and livelihoods. This article examines current overfishing trends, their impacts on fish populations and coastal communities, and evidence-based solutions for coastal water management and conservation.
excerpt: Strategies to combat overfishing and protect marine ecosystems.
author: Marine Biologist

title: Understanding IUU Fishing: Challenges and Solutions
content: Illegal, Unreported and Unregulated (IUU) fishing undermines conservation efforts and economic sustainability. This comprehensive guide explores detection methods, enforcement challenges, international cooperation frameworks, and community-based monitoring systems.
excerpt: A comprehensive overview of IUU fishing and effective countermeasures.
author: Fisheries Inspector

title: Sustainable Aquaculture Practices in Sri Lanka
content: Aquaculture presents opportunities for sustainable fish production while reducing pressure on wild stocks. This article discusses best practices for fish farming, environmental considerations, and the role of aquaculture in meeting growing seafood demand.
excerpt: Exploring sustainable aquaculture as an alternative to wild-caught fish.
author: Aquaculture Specialist
